posts.name: Salt
posts.cooked:
Mastodon – 7 Nov 24

Signal Update Info (@SignalUpdateInfo@mastodon.world)

Attached: 2 images #Signal's logo is getting a small refresh! Before/after:

This thread will serve as a spot to merge discussions about Signal’s new logo.

link_counts.title: Signal Update Info: "#Signal's logo is getting a small refresh! Befor…" - Mastodon
Latest version has a weird icon

posts.cooked:
Beta feedback for the upcoming Android 7.24 release

★ The new and slightly refreshed Signal logo can help you digitally experience the feeling of seeing a good friend right after they get a haircut (but it’s not a completely new hairstyle).
★ Chat folders let you organize your organizations, group your groups, and individualize your individuals into unique folders that are easy to customize and rearrange.

(I know the chat folder note is a repeat, it’s intentional)

New release notes added about 40 minutes ago, thanks @greyson-signal

Edit 1: Could you add a before and after screenshot of the old and new logo?
On the Signal brand page (Signal >> Signal Brand Assets) it still shows updated on 2 October 2024.
Blue colour shows colour name is #3A76F0 (zero at the end)

Edit 2:

Beta feedback for the upcoming Android 7.24 release

Update brand logo. [36]

Looks like the new blue is #3B45FD

Edit 3: (1 Like)

10000311871080×699 26.2 KB

Old blue on the left, new blue on the right
Source for screenshot above: 3a76f0 vs 3b45fd | Compare and see visual color differences - colorxs.com

posts.cooked:
The new blue seems too intense to me.
It almost hurts my eyes when I look at it.
A little bit darker or more pastel colored would be better imho.

I hope you understand what I mean.

Beta feedback for the upcoming Android 7.24 release

I really dislike the new “Signal blue”, it looks way too dark in dark mode

I like it. Looks more signal-ish now, before it was too close to Telegram.

link_counts.title: Beta feedback for the upcoming Android 7.24 release

posts.cooked:
No matter how much it changes, all the blue shades are taken

10000854341039×1760 191 KB

I really dislike the new darker shade of the app icon.

hans84:

The new blue seems too intense to me.
It almost hurts my eyes when I look at it.

I completely agree.

I loved the old color. Could we please get it back in the settings > appearance > app icon area? Please add the old icon into this so that those of us who dislike it can go back to it.

posts.name: AlertSubject
posts.cooked:
nullptr:

Could we please get it back in the settings

Since this is an update to their branding I don’t think they want the old one to stick around

AlertSubject:

don’t think they want the old one to stick around

* sigh *

I don’t see why they needed to do this in the first place. “Change for the sake of change”

I can’t seem to understand why, but of all the things that annoy me, this icon change has to be the one of the biggest ones, if not the biggest one when I saw it. All of my signal contacts (2 people … lol) said they dislike it.

posts.name: Hugo
posts.cooked: I agree with the sentiment, but I use the dark app icon anyway so it didn’t affect me on Android (PC icon looks weird, though: apart from the obvious color change, it’s smaller than before)

Oh well.

I don’t know why I’m being so passionate about this.

Between my opinions about moderation here, and signal roadmap (or lack thereof), I think I’ll stop being passionate about signal and adoption. Perhaps it’s time I spend it elsewhere. KDE seems like a good place. Very productive discussions. Hopefully this isn’t too off-topic. I’ll try not to care anymore.

Huh. I came here because I thought that the nearly-invisible icon in my desktop’s tray was a graphics glitch. Is the all-blue logo the new standard for the tray? In my Start menu there’s the new two-color logo, but not in the tray. It’s even darker on my screen than on the screenshot, but I like you too much to take a photo of my monitor.

I’m also wondering why the colour has changed. When a design is changed, the pattern often changes but not the colours. Has it been criticised for looking too much like Telegram’s blue? But that doesn’t explain the decision to use such an… ugly blue (sorry, but let’s call a spade a spade).

same version here 7.33.0

@ Signal Team: please consider adding the old colors as an option in the appearance settings. You don’t have to remove the new icon/color but adding an option to use the “old” color does no harm to anybody and would make a lot of users happy.
Cheers
